Package wt.verification

Provides a mechanism for verifying objects passed as arguments from client to server code.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Verifier
    This interface specifies a method for verifying a single Persistable or a collection of Persistables.

Package wt.verification Description

Provides a mechanism for verifying objects passed as arguments from client to server code.

This package support classes and methods for Windchill server code that is directly callable from clients for verifying that Persistable objects passed as arguments do not have attribute values set by the client that are only intended to be set by the server.

Every Persistable object's PersistInfo contains a wt.fc.PersistInfo#verified flag. The value is initialized to true within the MethodServer and false elsewhere. The value of this flag is managed within the MethodServer to indicate when an object has become unverified. This is based on the deserialization of the object from a source client.

The main verification processing is implemented in wt.verification.VerificationHelper#verify(wt.fc.Persistable) and wt.verification.VerificationHelper#verify(wt.fc.collections.WTCollection). For each unverified object, a Verifier implementation is used to perform the actual verification processing. The Verifier implementation is looked up using a delegate specified in services.properties. For example, if a class, "myPackage.MyClass" requires the delegate "myPackage.MyClassVerifier", then the following service.properties.xconf entry would be used. 

         
<Service context="default" name="wt.verification.Verifier">
     <Option cardinality="singleton" order="1" requestor="myPackage.MyClass" serviceClass="myPackage.MyClassVerifier" selector="DEFAULT"/>
</Service>
